name: Goatsrue-Galega officinalis
description: Herbaceous perennial 2-6 feet high with racemes of white, purple, or blue pea-like flowers.
appearance: Perennial legume that ranges from 2-6 feet in height.
Alternate, pinnately compound leaves with 6-10 pairs of leaflets (1- 5cm long). Tip of each leaflet has a small hair-like appendage.
Stipules (leaf-like appendage at the base of each leaf) are arrowhead shaped.
Purple to white, pea-like flowers are borne in terminal or axillary racemes containing 20-50 flowers. Plant blooms from June throughout the growing season.
Seed pods are narrow and about 1 inch long.
Seeds are dull yellow, bean shaped and approximately 2.5-3mm long.
